text: The Restoration of Israel
But Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob,
and he will again choose Israel
and set them on their land,
and the immigrant will join himself to them,
and they will attach themselves to the house of Jacob.
And \add the\add* nations will take them
and bring them to their place,
and the house of Israel will take possession of them\f + \fr 14:2 \ft That is, the nations \f* in the land of Yahweh
as slaves and female slaves.
And this will happen:
they will take their captors captive
and rule over their oppressors.
The Downfall of the King of Babylon
And it shall happen on the day Yahweh gives you rest from your pain and turmoil and hard labor which ⸤you had to perform⸥,\f + \fr 14:3 \ft Literally “was worked by you” \f*
that you will take this taunt against the king of Babylon,
and you will say:
“How \add the\add* oppressor has ceased!
\add his\add* insolence\f + \fr 14:4 \ft The meaning of the word is uncertain; others translate it as “fury,” “hostility,” or even “golden city” \f* has ceased.
Yahweh has broken \add the\add* staff of \add the\add* wicked,
\add the\add* scepter of rulers,
that struck \add the\add* peoples in wrath, a blow without ceasing,
that ruled \add the\add* nations in anger
⸤with unrestrained persecution⸥.\f + \fr 14:6 \ft Literally “persecution without withholding” \f*
All of the earth rests \add and\add* is quiet;
they break forth \add into\add* singing.
Even \add the\add* cypresses rejoice over you,
the cedars of Lebanon:
‘Since you were laid down,
no \add wood\add* cutter comes up against us.’
Sheol below is getting excited over you,
to meet ⸤you when you come⸥;\f + \fr 14:9 \ft Literally “your entrance” \f*
it arouses \add the\add* dead spirits for you,
all of \add the\add* leaders of \add the\add* earth.
It raises all of \add the\add* kings of \add the\add* nations from their thrones.
All of them will respond and say to you,
‘You yourself also were made weak like us!
You have become the same as us!’
Your pride is brought down \add to\add* Sheol,
\add and\add* the sound of your harps;
maggots\f + \fr 14:11 \ft Hebrew “maggot” \f* are spread out beneath you like a bed,
and your covering is worms.\f + \fr 14:11 \ft Hebrew “worm” \f*
How you have fallen from heaven, morning star, son of dawn!
You are cut down to the ground, conqueror of nations!
And you yourself said in your heart,
‘I will ascend \add to\add* heaven;
I will raise up my throne above the stars of God;
and I will sit on \add the\add* mountain of assembly
on the summit of Zaphon;\f + \fr 14:13 \ft Or “of the north” \f*
I will ascend to \add the\add* high places of \add the\add* clouds,\f + \fr 14:14 \ft Hebrew “cloud” \f*
I will make myself like the Most High.’
But you are brought down to Sheol,
to \add the\add* depths of \add the\add* pit.
Those who see you will stare at you,
they will look closely at you:
‘\add Is\add* this the man who made the earth tremble,
who caused kingdoms to shake,
who made \add the\add* world like the desert
and destroyed its cities,
\add who\add* would not let his prisoners go home?’
All \add the\add* kings of \add the\add* nations, all of them, lie in glory,
each one in his house.
But \add as for\add* you, you are thrown away from your grave,
like an abhorrent shoot,
clothed with \add the\add* slain,
those pierced \add by the\add* sword,
those who go down to \add the\add* stones of \add the\add* pit,
like a corpse that is trodden down.
You will not be united with them in burial
because you have destroyed your land,
you have killed your people.
\add The\add* descendants\f + \fr 14:20 \ft Hebrew “descendant” \f* of evildoers will not be mentioned for eternity!
Prepare a place of slaughter for his sons
because of the sin of their ancestors.\f + \fr 14:21 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
Let them not rise and take possession of \add the\add* earth
or fill up \add the\add* face of \add the\add* world \add with\add* cities.”
“And I will rise up against them,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 14:22 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh of hosts,
“and I will cut off name and a remnant from Babylon,
and offspring and posterity,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 14:22 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“And I will make her a possession of \add the\add* hedgehog,
and pools of water,
and I will sweep her away with \add the\add* broom of destruction,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 14:23 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh of hosts.
Oracle of Judgment on Assyria
Yahweh of hosts has sworn, saying,
“⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 14:24 \ft The oath formula begins literally “If not” \f* just as I have intended, so it shall be.
And just as I have planned, it shall stand:
to break Assyria in my land,
and I will trample him down on my mountains;
and he shall remove his yoke from them,
and he shall remove his burden from his\f + \fr 14:25 \ft That is, their \f* shoulders.”\f + \fr 14:25 \ft Hebrew “shoulder” \f*
This \add is\add* the plan that is planned concerning all of the earth;
and this \add is\add* the hand that is stretched out over all of the nations.
For Yahweh of hosts has planned, and who will frustrate \add it\add*?
And his hand \add is\add* stretched out, and who will turn it back?
Oracle of Judgment on Philistia
In the year of the death of king Ahaz there was this oracle:
You must not rejoice, all you Philistines,
that the rod that struck you is broken,
for a viper will come forth from \add the\add* root of \add the\add* snake,
and its fruit \add will be\add* a flying serpent.
And \add the\add* firstborn of \add the\add* poor will graze,
and \add the\add* needy will lie down in security;
but I will cause your root to die in famine,
and it will kill your remnant.
Wail, gate! Cry, city!
Melt,\f + \fr 14:31 \ft With fear or despair \f* Philistia, all of you!
For smoke \add is\add* coming from \add the\add* north,
and there is no straggler in his ranks.
And what will one answer \add the\add* messengers of \add the\add* nation?
That Yahweh has founded Zion,
and the needy of his people will take refuge in it.
